MetricGroups.Name: Core Metrics
MetricGroups.Description: These benchmarks define the library's primary success criteria. They should generally reflect positive outcomes and remain stable as the library evolves, with regressions carefully monitored and addressed.

Metrics.Name: Indirect invocation on small objects via `proxy` vs. `std::unique_ptr` + virtual functions
Indirect invocation on small objects via `proxy_view` vs. raw pointer + virtual functions
Indirect invocation on small objects via `proxy` (shared ownership) vs. `std::shared_ptr` + virtual functions
Indirect invocation on large objects via `proxy` vs. `std::unique_ptr` + virtual functions
Indirect invocation on large objects via `proxy_view` vs. raw pointer + virtual functions
Indirect invocation on large objects via `proxy` (shared ownership) vs. `std::shared_ptr` + virtual functions
Creation for small objects with `proxy` vs. `std::unique_ptr`
Creation for small objects with `proxy` (exclusive ownership) vs. `std::shared_ptr` (with memory pool)
Creation for large objects with `proxy` (with memory pool) vs. `std::unique_ptr`
Creation for large objects with `proxy` (shared ownership) vs. `std::shared_ptr` (both with memory pool)

MetricGroups.Name: Comparative Metrics
MetricGroups.Description: These benchmarks provide perspective by comparison with other well-known implementations. They are not required to consistently show positive results, but instead highlight relative strengths, trade-offs, and areas of differentiation.

Metrics.Name: Creation for small objects with `proxy` (exclusive ownership) vs. `std::shared_ptr` (without memory pool)
Creation for small objects with `proxy` (shared ownership) vs. `std::shared_ptr` (both without memory pool)
Creation for small objects with `proxy` (shared ownership) vs. `std::shared_ptr` (both with memory pool)
Creation for small objects with `proxy` vs. `std::any`
Creation for large objects with `proxy` (without memory pool) vs. `std::unique_ptr`
Creation for large objects with `proxy` (exclusive ownership) vs. `std::shared_ptr` (both without memory pool)
Creation for large objects with `proxy` (exclusive ownership) vs. `std::shared_ptr` (both with memory pool)
Creation for large objects with `proxy` (shared ownership) vs. `std::shared_ptr` (both without memory pool)
Creation for large objects with `proxy` (without memory pool) vs. `std::any`
Creation for large objects with `proxy` (with memory pool) vs. `std::any`

MetricGroups.Name: Observational Metrics
MetricGroups.Description: These benchmarks are included for completeness and transparency. While they may not represent target outcomes, they offer valuable context for users to understand the broader characteristics of the library.

Metrics.Name: Relocation on small objects via `proxy` (trivially-relocatable by default) vs. `proxy` (nothrow-relocatable)
Relocation on small objects via `proxy` vs. `std::unique_ptr`
Relocation on small objects via `proxy` vs. `std::any`
Relocation on large objects via `proxy` (trivially-relocatable by default) vs. `proxy` (nothrow-relocatable)
Relocation on large objects via `proxy` vs. `std::unique_ptr`
Relocation on large objects via `proxy` vs. `std::any`
